newsitem.title: USA: Allied Products net up as margins improve.
newsitem.headline: Allied Products net up as margins improve.

text.p: Allied Products Corp on Wednesday said increased margins helped boost first-quarter earnings slightly in spite of lower sales in the period.

The company said first-quarter net income rose to $5.2 million, or $0.63 a share, from $5.1 million, or $0.56, in the same period last year, when there were more common shares outstanding. Sales slipped to $72.9 million from $75.2 million in the first quarter of 1996.
Allied Products said it expected 1997 earnings to exceed last year's results based on anticipated strong performance of all of its operations.
Allied Products makes large metal stamping presses, agricultural equipment and thermoplastic compounds.
